channel.title: Programming on Code with Hugo
channel.description: Recent content in Programming on Code with Hugo

item.title: Learn git even if you don’t code
item.description: The tools we wield define us, git is the one tool all developers use Git is a ubiquitous version control tool. The way it works tightly correlates with software engineering and the mindsets of developers. It was purpose-built and designed to be used for the development of the Linux Kernel, one of the largest software projects that’s depended on by millions of developers. Your editing workflow is painful because it’s not version-controlled As part of a team, your editing workflow probably consists of sending a file back and forth for review, comment and amendments.
